content: at a craft store or bead shop ➢ pliers for squishing crimps - raid hubby s tool box ➢ you can also use a knot to secure the strings to the mandala if you do this dab a blob of clear nail polish onto the knot to secure it ➢ feathers - most craft stores sell dyed chicken feathers which are perfect or you can use artificial feathers if there is a risk of sensitivity to animal products ➢ feathers can be attached by dropping some glue into the hole of the bead and gluing the feather ➢ 1 6 metres 6mm white satin ribbon ➢ 1 6 metres 6mm yellow satin ribbon ➢ 2 4 metres 12mm yellow organza ribbon ➢ 2 4 metres 8mm white organza ribbon ➢ metal key ring to loop through the mandala for hanging tester hints you might consider using the jump ring that usually comes with key rings that s the little chain part and it helps the hoop swing more freely or you can use a swivel clasp 3 yar n colours and quantities ➢ if you are not working your mandala in my choice of yarn your quantities may differ ➢ yarn thickness and hook size will also affect the overall size of your mandala ➢ all of my yarn quantities are rounded up to the nearest 10 grams ➢ colors will be listed round by round colourway sand 20grams / 50m golden yellow 50grams / 125m marigold 10grams / 25m 4 ten sion and gauge ➢ it is important to match my gauge or your mandala may be too big or small for the ring ➢ after working round 7 your mandala should measure 8cm approx 3 ➢ after working round 11 your mandala should measure 13cm approx 5 ➢ after working round 15 your mandala should measure 18cm approx 7 5 ➢ after working round 22 your mandala should measure 25cm approx 10 this is 5 centimetres smaller in diameter than the ring leaving a 2 - 2 5 cm gap all the way around refer to the picture on the next page in stuffs to know 6 stu ffs to know this pattern uses us terminology you will note that my starting chain for a double_crochet and half_double_crochet is 2 i e ch2 this is just a personal preference you are welcome to start with ch3 for a double_crochet and ch2 for a half_double_crochet or even start with a standing stitch do what is comfortable for you -
